H0.text: Sediments cool to form sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Sediments melt is the process by which sedimentary rock forms.

H2.text: Sediments separate to form sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Sediments compress over time under pressure to form sedimentary rock.

A4.text: Lithification follows closely on compaction, as increased temperatures at depth hasten the precipitation of cement that binds the grains together.

A5.text: Pressure solution contributes to this process of cementation, as the mineral dissolved from strained contact points is redeposited in the unstrained pore spaces. This further reduces porosity and makes the rock more compact and competent.
